intro: Hieracium alliicolor, commonly known as the garlic-yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant features bright yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are usually hairy and somewhat reddish. Hieracium alliicolor is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in many temperate regions.
